storyInfo: The thing that guides us ahead is not the ritual itself, but we ourselves after we go through the whole experience. 'Only you can find the right way forward for yourself, and it is only with your own two legs that you can walk that path.'

attributes.content: Hm? How deep are we?
attributes.name: Weary-eyed Gravedigger

attributes.content: Reckon we should dig a little more?
attributes.name: Pasty-faced Gravedigger

attributes.content: It'll all be a wasteland here sooner or later. It's not like you could stick wheels under the graves.
attributes.name: Pasty-faced Gravedigger

attributes.content: Folks want to leave behind some trace of their lives after they die... but it's all a pointless dream, sadly. Might as well ask for a cremation and have your ashes scattered in the wilderness.
attributes.name: Pasty-faced Gravedigger

attributes.content: That would put us out of a job, though.
attributes.name: Weary-eyed Gravedigger

attributes.content: True enough.
attributes.name: Pasty-faced Gravedigger

attributes.content: If you ask me, graves aren't for the dead. It's the living who need these things... The ceremonies and the big chunk of rock that goes on top of them.
attributes.name: Weary-eyed Gravedigger

attributes.content: Those are the things that folks say their goodbyes to before starting anewâ€”
attributes.name: Weary-eyed Gravedigger

attributes.content: Hah, until it's their turn to bite the dust.
attributes.name: Pasty-faced Gravedigger

attributes.content: The preparations for the ritual are almost complete.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: I... I'm not sure.
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: I... I don't feel so good today...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Mamma...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Mister Friar, I was really happy yesterday...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Rosella told me about lots of fun stuff... We prepared for the funeral together, and it felt like... I was doing something for Mamma.
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: But... we're done with everything now... What comes next?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: I think... I worked really hard... for Mamma...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: But... can Mamma see all that?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Does all of this... really mean something?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Mister Friar, have you gone through this a lot?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: When it happens... during... the funeral... what... what should I do?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: And what do I do... once it's over?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Hm. Right, the funeral...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You're still young, but I don't want to hide anything from you.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: We do a lot of things for others, but, in the end, we do it for ourselves.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Cecelia, this isn't selfishness. Rather, it just means that, ultimately, everything that the living do is to mold and shape themselves.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: We hold funerals and say our goodbyes when our loved ones leave us, but it's also a respite for ourselves.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It's a way to mark the road that we've trodden.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Many grown-ups... use this as a way to find peace, but whether they truly find it, or indeed anything, isn't the fault of the funeral itself.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It's really up to us, after we go through the thing.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Once we are done looking back and resting, we must keep going forward.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But where do we go after that?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: That is something you need to ask yourself, Cecelia.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: This is a question that only you can answer yourself, and it's a question that both you, I, and everyone must answer in our lifetimes.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Ask myself...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Only you can find the right way forward for yourself, and it is only with your own two legs that you can walk that path.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: What about you, Mister Friar? You know so much... What is your road like?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: I can't answer you that. I'm afraid I can't even say I've found it.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It's a tough search, and a sad journey. It makes you wonder if the way forward ever truly exists.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But I haven't given up, and that is why I, and my brothers and sisters, call ourselves...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: ...'the Pathfinders.'
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Candelabra, candelabra. Where does one find...?
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: (Somebody's there... That Liberi from the hospital? Patia, was it? And the Legatus called Oren, too.
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: I really don't get it. What is that guy even doing?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Watch your words, Oren.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: This is the perfect time to act. There are lots of other things we could be doing besides wasting time on a funeral.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: And I thought you were close to the girl's mother. How cold-blooded of you.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: I'd already made my decision when I told Andoain about Cecelia.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: She's capable of knocking this city off its godly throne.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: That also means she can shake that saint who's always hiding behind the red and gold curtain... and plenty of others besides.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: (What is he talking about?)
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: A Sankta wants to bring down his holy city with the help of a mixed-blood girl? Scandalous.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: You make it sound like I just want to burn it all down for no good reason. I said 'capable.' That doesn't mean we have to do it.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: In fact, if we don't do it, then her worth as a bargaining chip is that much more.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: I just have to make sure Cecelia doesn't end up in the Pope's hands... On that point at least, Andoain and I are aligned.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: A word of advice.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: I don't know what kind of tricks you're trying to play with Cecelia, but do not forget the promise you made to the Guide.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Thanks for the tip... I don't mind walking this path with you folks for a little longer.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Now, you'll have to excuse me. I have better places to be than a funeral.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: (Looks like they aren't all on the same wavelength.)
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: (But what worries me more... is that there's a Legatus involved.)
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: (I'll take Cecelia and leave once the funeral is over.)
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: Cecelia. Cecelia!
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: Senior Ezell, the funeral will be starting soon.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Andoain, I don't care about your grand ideals, and I'm not interested in discussing faith with you.
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: So once the funeral is over... I'm leaving with Cecelia.
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: Where will you go?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: None of your concern.
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: It's time to light the candles, Senior Ezell. Go, be with Cecelia.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The early spring mornings are still frigid here in Laterano.
Sankta funerals are often accompanied by laughter, music, sweets, and the occasional, inconsequential explosion.
The departed become one with the Holy Spirit and return to Heaven. This is worthy of celebration.
But there is another kind of Sankta 'funeral' unknown to other races:
On a certain hour of a certain day, a great sorrow will seize all Sankta by the throat. They will not be able to move, breathe, or avert their eyes.
Each and every fragile soul will be swept away as if by the floodwaters of a broken dam.
Yet neither the joy of the former nor the awesome power of the latter can be found today in the Ecclesia Requietum of Pagus Stevonus.
We find only a frail girl, trying her hardest to swing the absurdly unwieldy shovel in her hands.
A girl trying to shovel the last bit of dirt onto her mother's resting place.
Go, Cecelia. It's time to see goodbye.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Mamma... What should I do?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: When I think to myself that... I'm doing this for Mamma, I don't feel scared of anything... I feel like I can do anything.
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: It feels like I've gotten a little stronger since you've been gone... Is it because I got a little older?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: But Mister Ezell says... I won't get to see you anymore. Even if I grow up and grow even stronger, I won't see you again... right?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: When I do a good job, you won't be there to reward me... When I do something bad, you won't be there to get angry at me...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: So, why should I grow up?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Mister Friar says... I'm doing your funeral and saying goodbye to you... for myself...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: What does it mean to do something for myself?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: I'm scared... Mamma...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: A few days ago, a prioress lady that I don't know told me that, whether we do it with tears or smiles, the ones who are leaving us will accept our goodbyes.
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: I don't get it... Mamma, should I cry, or should I smile?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Mister Friar said it's a question for myself... but I... I don't know...
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: There is no rush, Cecelia.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You still have lots of time.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Too bad, then, that yours just ran out.
Hey, been a while.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I've finally got you, Andoain.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Mostima, Fiammetta... my dear old friends, long time no see.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: If you're here to mourn the dead, I'm afraid you came a little too late.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: That's alright.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: We can always make some more.
attributes.name: Fiammetta
